title: Home security system catches Amazon worker stealing cat
description: A home security system has caught the moment an Amazon worker taking a cat from outside a home in Lakewood, California. An Amazon representative said the individual involved was an independent contractor who uses their personal vehicle to deliver parcels. As of Tuesday, December 16, Piper still remains missing. #amazon #cat #stolen #cctv

title: Police probe wider network in Bondi massacre | 7NEWS
description: Federal police are investigating potential further arrests following the Bondi Beach massacre, examining whether gunman Naveed Akram and his father Sajid had outside assistance. Investigators are conducting additional raids and search warrants while piecing together evidence from the terror attack, including the pair's recent four-week trip to the southern Philippines. Police are working with international partners including Filipino and Indian authorities to build a complete picture of the alleged offenders' movements and contacts both domestically and offshore. title: Bondi shooting victims remembered by families | 7NEWS
description: Six people were killed in a shooting at Bondi, including Adam Smyth, a 50-year-old father of four who was walking with his wife, husband and wife Boris and Sofia Gurman, French citizen Dan Elkayam, Marika Pogany who migrated to Australia in 1968, and Rabbi Eli Schlanger who left behind five children. Families of the victims have shared memories of their loved ones as floral tributes grow at the Bondi pavilion. A fundraiser for Rabbi Schlanger's family is approaching one million dollars. title: Bondi reopens after shooting massacre | 7NEWS
description: Bondi Beach reopened to the public for the first time since Sunday's shooting massacre, drawing crowds of mourners to the crime scene locations including the footbridge where gunmen opened fire. Survivor Arsen Ostrovsky, who suffered a bullet wound to the head, returned to ask the community to light candles at 6:47 each night during Hanukkah in honour of the victims. First responders, NRL players from the Roosters, and families gathered at a makeshift memorial as the community continues searching for answers. title: Terror attack at Bondi Hanukkah celebrations | 7NEWS
description: A terror attack unfolded at Bondi Beach during Hanukkah by the Sea celebrations, where two gunmen parked a silver Hyundai with a homemade Islamic State-style flag and opened fire on families and children. Boris and Sophia Gurman were killed trying to confront the attackers, while Ahmed El Ahmed wrestled a weapon away from gunman Sajid Akram before Detective Senior Constable Cesar Baratza shot both attackers, killing one and injuring the other.
